etymologies: early 20th century: apparently from archaic nim ‘to take’ or from German nimm! ‘take!’, imperative of nehmen

definitions: a game in which two players alternately take one or more objects from one of a number of heaps, each trying to take, or to compel the other to take, the last remaining object.
shortDefinitions: game in which two players alternately take one or more objects from one of several heaps, each trying to take, or to compel other to take
